docs.lead_paragraph: Throughout 2012, as signs mounted that militants in Syria were growing stronger, the debate in the White House followed a pattern. In meeting after meeting, as officials from agencies outside the executive residence advocated arming pro-Western rebels or other forms of action, President Barack Obama’s closest White House aides bluntly delivered the president’s verdict: no.

docs.abstract: Timothy Egan Op-Ed column questions why American voters, majority of whom oppose what Republican Party stands for, appear ready to give them control of Senate and greater hold on House in elections; lists number of risks that greater Republican control of Congress poses and urges voters to consider exactly what Republicans believe; accuses GOP of petty partisanship and, in some cases, crazy thinking.
